title: We Need More Champions Like Draven
body:
And no, I'm not talking about the personality. I'm talking about his design. Draven has this special way of playing called "Juggling" that makes him a lot different than other ADCs. It makes him difficult to play, but it pays off so much with that 85% increased damage at Rank 5. Some people like "Juggling", while others don't. HOWEVER, it isn't that they don't like it because it's clunky or bad or anything like that. People don't like it because they just don't like it. They don't like the juggling movement pattern and attack pattern and such. They want something else.
This is what should be wanted in every champion. A kit that DOES NOT appeal to the grand majority, but a smaller minority of players. A kit that plays differently from every other champion in the game and has a different style of play. Not a kit that doesn't appeal because it's strange or clunky, but because it just doesn't fit what the player wants to do in the game. That is exactly the type of champions we need. We need more Dravens.

EDIT: I think people are a little confused about what I'm saying here at times. I want champions to accomplish their goals in a different way from everyone else. Because they do this in a different way, they can be unappealing to other players who DON'T want to accomplish their end goal in that way.
For example, say the end goal for two champions is: Deal Damage to the Enemy Team. Now let's get more specific. Say they are both ADCs and want to deal damage. The goal is for them to be different. So, let's say we make Champion #1 deal damage by shooting the enemy, but has limited ammo. Let's say this is Jhin.
Now, we have to create Champion #2. Champion #2 deals his damage in a unique way from Jhin, even though Jhin is unique still. Champion #2, let's say, has a passive that splits himself into two separate units with different spells. You have to micro manage these units to deal optimal damage. This might not be what people want to do to achieve their goal, and some of those people will like Jhin.

Basically, in this game where there are 130 champions, each champion should be unique enough to really CLICK with one certain person and no one else. This way, everyone has a champion that fits their play style EXACTLY, but is likely not a champion others can play. Every player needs a champion like Draven who clicks with them, but is not popular mainly because players outside his player base just don't like how he plays.

Allow me to explain, because (especially with Ziggs) he is correct.

Let me break it down:
1. You enter a game and you have a role. Whether that be Tank, Fighter, Mage, etc.
2. You look at your champion and know what you want to be doing. This should be a lot easier to do with Subclasses. (Side note that they need to add the unique classes of Ganker and Pusher IMO)
3. From there, you see how exactly you will be doing what you want to do.
4. Do that.
5. If what you did can be directly compared, even slightly, to any other champion in the way you did it (and not outcome, but the process itself), this is not a unique champion (and therefore not a Draven)

Ziggs, for example, is different now. Before, his objective was really just push waves with spells and then use his passive to deal more damage to a tower. He was a pretty generic Mage Pusher. Now, this method can be a lot different. Instead of using his spells entirely to push the wave, he can now do something unique, being executing towers.
Ziggs can now HIT AND RUN towers so to speak. His W new mechanic is powerful and unique enough to warrant a change in play among Ziggs to become perhaps a dedicated Pusher mage. Before, it was AoE Mage. Now it is really Pusher Mage. I want Riot to continue this trend and maybe even expand upon this with Ziggs, giving him more potential Pushing mechanics.

Most players do not want to dedicate so much time and effort into learning her ins and outs or the various combos, but those that do enjoy the "Street Fighter" feel of correctly chaining your abilities in order to beat your opponent.
her animation cancling is on almost everyone with an auto attack reset in their kits. riven really doesnt take much to play =\

Here's a combo I use to kill someone early game where I don't have much damage.

ER > WQ > Auto > Q2 > Auto > Q3 > R2 > Auto

ER removes the animation of Riven stopping to pull out her sword, this also stops her from stunning herself while the animation plays.

After casting E, you can shortly use either W or R along with Q to "Doublecast". This allows Riven to use 2 abilities at the same time, overlapping their animations. I use WQ because it stuns my target at the same time I use Q while also canceling my auto animation if I time it correctly.

Anytime I use Q on my target, I take the cursor off them and issue a move command on the ground by clicking and then immediately put my mouse back on them and click to issue an attack command. This has to be done while still in the animation of Q, and doing so removes the self stun allowing you to auto attack slightly sooner. This is known as "Fast Q".

Example of Fast Q: https://49.media.tumblr.com/2369f9e3d26d8efd7fa771671615d3dd/tumblr_n7hm3ov6Qy1qd16pfo1_500.gif

I then use Q3, the knockup, before using R2, Windslash, so my target is CC'ed and cannot flash out of my ultimate.

Here's a mid/late-game assassin combo known as "The Shy" combo, since it was created by a Korean challenger named "The Shy". They are considered to have the smoothest animation canceling ever seen.

The combo goes: ER > Flash > W > Auto > Tiamat/Hydra > R2 > Q

Video of the combo only without the ER > Flash setup:
https://youtu.be/WSNjGMOT7S4
